moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 Nf6 4. Nc3 Bc: Speeding through the opening with out losing any time on the clock. In a very simple and common position to this point.
moves.8. Be3: Looking to remove the Black Bishop and possibly open up the f-file for my rook.
Putting my Knight on a nice central square and offering a trade.
moves.12. Nf4: Opening up the Bishop's diagonal aiming at the Black King.
moves.12... Ne5: Threatening to trade Knight for Bishop.
moves.13. Bb3: Bishop is too valuable to trade for the Knight at this point.
moves.13... Qg5: Threatening QxN and Bxh6 if the Knight is moved
moves.15... f5 16. Be6: BxB, NxB is a fork of Queen and Rook
moves.17... Nf3+: Infiltrating white protection. This Knight will become a thorn in my side for many moves to come
moves.18. Kh1: Kg1 or Kg2 result in RxN for free
moves.18... Rxf4:
Still can take Knight due to the mating combination of:
gxR, Qxg, then unstoppable mate on h2 with the Queen
moves.19. Bxb7: Attacking the Rook and the pawn on e4
moves.19... Rh4: Rxh3 results in unstoppable mate after Kg2 then Rh2
moves.21... Ne1+: Realizes he is in trouble with all of the attacked pieces and begins to try an attack, but is too late
moves.22. Qxe1 Qf3+ 23. Kg1 Rf8 24. gxh4 Qf4 2:
Black resigns at this point due to the lost pawn on e and the lack of available material.

 I end up going 4.5-.5 on the day. Might annotate the rest of them if I get a chance.

I appreciate any and all comments. Feel free to message me too if you see something interesting.
